subject: World Cup (Skiing)
Skiing
lead_paragraph: Lindsey Vonn received a big confidence boost by sweeping the final two races before the world championships. Vonn completed a highly successful weekend on Sunday in Garmisch-Partenkirchen, Germany, mastering a demanding course for her first super-G win in two years after winning the slalom on Friday. Her focus now turns to the worlds, which start Tuesday in Val d’Isère, France, with another super-G. Vonn, the defending World Cup champion, increased her lead over Maria Riesch of Germany to 179 points in this season’s points race.
